result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex L Lafond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA sample - Voting rights and firearms restrictions given 
Sex offender evaluation and treatment
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alex L Lafond in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Stipulated agreement recited by Dunphy - Victim impact statement provided to court - Victms rights have been complied with - Count 2 DRI - Plea no contest to count 1 - Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court - Court advises defenant of voting rights/Firearms possession - Arguments by Dunphy/Cirilli/Defendant/Court to sentencing
Sentence withheld - 5 years probation - 90 days jail with huber - To begin on or before 9:00am 5/2/16  - Can have a different start date if agreed on between PO and defendant -  DNA sample - Start date can be worked out with PO - Sex offender evaluation and treatment - No contact with victim KMB 1/23/1999 - Counseling as recommended by PO - CC/surcharges - Post conviction rights given
Defendant's Response to State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant Alex L Lafond in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing - Court finds waiver of preliminary hearing is free and voluntary - Court finds probable cause that a felony had been committed and binds defendant over for further proceedings - Information filed with court - In receipt - Waive reading - Plea not guilty - bond continued  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 10:45 am.
No contact with KMD or her parents - Submit to booking at Lincoln County Sheriff's Departmnet
